features.name: Canny Defense
features.desc: When wearing light or no armor and not using a shield, a duelist adds 1 point of {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} (if any) per duelist {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} as a dodge bonus to her {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g} while wielding a melee weapon. If a duelist is caught {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g} or otherwise denied her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} bonus, she also loses this bonus.

features.name: Precise Strike
features.desc:
A duelist gains the ability to strike precisely with a light or {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}one-handed{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing{/g} weapon, adding her duelist level to her {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage roll{/g}.
To make a precise strike, a duelist cannot have a weapon in her other hand or use a shield. A duelist's precise strike only works against creatures with discernible anatomies. Any creature that is immune to {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} is also immune to a precise strike, and any item or ability that protects a creature from critical hits also protects a creature from a precise strike.

features.name: Improved Reaction
features.desc: At 2nd level, a duelist gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}. At 8th level, the bonus increases to +4. This bonus stacks with the benefit provided by the Improved Initiative {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.

features.name: Parry
features.desc:
At 2nd level, a duelist learns to parry {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} of other creatures, causing them to miss. Whenever the duelist makes a full {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} with a light or {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}one-handed{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing{/g} weapon, she can attempt to parry the first attack against her or the first attack against adjacent ally.
To parry the attack, the duelist makes an attack {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g}, using the same {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} as the attack she chose to forego during her previous {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}. If her attack roll is greater than the roll of the attacking creature, the attack automatically misses. For each {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} category that the attacking creature is larger than the duelist, the duelist takes a –4 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on her attack roll. The duelist also takes a –4 penalty when attempting to parry an attack made against an adjacent ally.

features.name: Enhanced Mobility
features.desc: Starting at 3rd level, when wearing light or no armor and not using a shield, a duelist gains an additional +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g} caused when she moves out of a {g|Encyclopedia:Threatened_Area}threatened{/g} square.

features.name: Combat Reflexes
features.desc: You may make a number of additional {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. With this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, you may also make {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} of opportunity while {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g}.

features.name: Grace
features.desc: At 4th level, a duelist gains an additional +2 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all Reflex {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}.

features.name: Riposte
features.desc: Starting at 5th level, a duelist can make an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} against any creature whose {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} she successfully parries, so long as the creature she is attacking is within {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g}.

features.name: Acrobatic Movement
features.desc: At 6th level, a duelist movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is no longer reduced on difficult terrain. Depending on the circumstance, she may still need to make appropriate {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} to successfully move over the terrain.

features.name: Elaborate Defense
features.desc: At 7th level and higher, if a duelist chooses to fight defensively in melee combat, she gains an additional +1 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} for every 3 levels of duelist she has attained.

features.name: Deflect Arrows
features.desc: At 9th level, a duelist gains the benefit of the Deflect Arrows {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} when using a light or {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}one-handed{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing{/g} weapon. The duelist does not need a free hand to use this feat.

features.name: No Retreat
features.desc: At 9th level, enemies adjacent to the duelist that take a withdraw {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} from the duelist.

features.name: Crippling Critical
features.desc: When you confirm a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} using a light or {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}one-handed{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing{/g} weapon, you can apply one of the following {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} in addition to the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dealt: reduce the target's movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} by a half, {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} damage, –4 penalty on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, –4 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}, or 2d6 points of bleed damage. These penalties last for 1 minute, except for {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g}, which must be {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healed{/g} normally, and bleed damage, which continues until the target receives magic healing or leaves combat.
